title: Banned for 3rd party useage... wrongly accused
body:
Fellow Summoners,

I was gone from the game for about a year and ive now been back for like a small week.
I have only played Kennen since my return, play normal matches, no ranked to brush up my skills again.

And all of a sudden this morning a mail saying i got banned for 3rd party useage. And banned until Feb 22...

I have no idea how to even use anything, im playing from a Mac mini, just for fun.

I know i got an error message now or then cause the game could not connect. But retrying always worked without problems. I can't see anyone reporting me, as im always friendly and helpfull and get plenty honours for it.

I have tried sending a mail to Riot. Is there anything else i can do?

To say that i just bought Riot points for Kennens new skin :(.

Any advice?

Thanks,

Michael.

replies.body: Possibly another ban wave from 3rd party program users. But also when they ban people from this it also includes people who share accounts, or have given other people access to their account.

I understand what you are saying, but i have never shared my account, i wouldn't know why. 
I got a response back from Riot stating the same they said in the mail why i was banned, no details given.

I can easy make a new account, and already did to keep me busy, but what if something on my pc caused them to think i did use 3rd party? I have nothing related to this game except the game itself on my mac. So what stops them from banning me again? 

This is just not fair, they can just remove all they want from their game cause something somehow spotted something, even if ya didnt do it. 

I thought america used judge and jury? (thinking RIOT is US)

You definitely shared your account through pretty much all of the last month, and unfortunately, your friend didn't have the same respect for fair play that you did. 

Sorry to call you out here, but it's important that we utilize good information in our assumptions, and there's nothing "on your pc" that'd cause a false positive: **scripting suspensions are a result of scripting applications**.

> I thought america used judge and jury? (thinking RIOT is US)

this is a common misconception. Only the government is forced into using judge and jury. private corporations dont need judges, juries, or proof to evict you from their premises.
This is exactly my new concern, since Im building a new account and playing it from the same pc and the only one I play this game.

There is no problem playing two accounts on one PC.

There's a problem playing one account on two PCs.
If that were the case, my friend would have been banned, since he was the one playing with his account on my pc and his laptop. That's lame if I was banned for that or flagued somehow.

I think there's a failsafe for playing from the same IP.

There're also things like sudden change of summoner spells or champion pool, for example.
More accurately, there's a problem with two different people playing one account. The computer doesn't matter; people have multiple computers sometimes.
I do agree on that, although I didn't shared my account...
